item.title: Microsoft lifts Windows 11 24H2 block on PCs with USB scanners
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has lifted a compatibility block preventing Windows 11 24H2 upgrades after fixing a bug causing USB connection issues to some scanners. [...]

item.title: Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp hit by massive worldwide outage
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Facebook, Instagram, Threads, and WhatsApp suffered a massive worldwide Wednesday afternoon, with services impacted in varying degrees based on user's region. [...]

item.title: Russian cyber spies hide behind other hackers to target Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Russian cyber-espionage group Turla, aka "Secret Blizzard," is utilizing other threat actors' infrastructure to target Ukrainian military devices connected via Starlink. [...]

item.title: Operation PowerOFF shuts down 27 DDoS-for-hire platforms
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Law enforcement agencies from 15 countries have taken 27 DDoS-for-hire services offline, also known as "booters" or "stressers," arrested three administrators, and identified 300 customers of the platforms. [...]

item.title: Lynx ransomware behind Electrica energy supplier cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The Romanian National Cybersecurity Directorate (DNSC) says the Lynx ransomware gang breached Electrica Group, one of the largest electricity suppliers in the country. [...]

item.title: Krispy Kreme cyberattack impacts online orders and operations
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: US doughnut chain Krispy Kreme suffered a cyberattack in November that impacted portions of its business operations, including placing online orders. [...]

item.title: Wyden proposes bill to secure US telecoms after Salt Typhoon hacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: U.S. Senator Ron Wyden of Oregon announced a new bill to secure the networks of American telecommunications companies breached by Salt Typhoon Chinese state hackers earlier this year. [...]

item.title: WPForms bug allows Stripe refunds on millions of WordPress sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability in WPForms, a WordPress plugin used in over 6 million websites, could allow subscriber-level users to issue arbitrary Stripe refunds or cancel subscriptions. [...]

item.title: Ivanti warns of maximum severity CSA auth bypass vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Ivanti warned customers on Tuesday about a new maximum-severity authentication bypass vulnerability in its Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) solution. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5048652 update fixes new motherboard activation bug
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5048652 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2, which contains six fixes, including a fix that prevented Windows 10 from activating when you change a device's motherboard. [...]

item.title: Microsoft December 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 1 exploited zero-day, 71 flaws
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Today is Microsoft's December 2024 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 71 flaws, including one actively exploited zero-day vulnerability. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5048667 & KB5048685 cumulative updates released
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has released the Windows 11 KB5048667 and KB5048685 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities and issues. [...]
